title: Gaza starts to push back against Hamas
summary: Hundreds of people have taken to the streets of the Palestinian territory to demand an end to the war and the departure of Hamas. Israel, Fatah and Arab countries are seeking to keep the Islamist movement out of the post-war equation.

title: France and Britain offer to send 'reassurance force' to Ukraine once peace deal is reached
summary: The French president, who was speaking after a summit of European leaders in Paris on Thursday, added that a French-British delegation would head to Ukraine in the coming days to discuss the offer.

title: A stabbing attack in Amsterdam wounds five people, including four foreigners
summary: The attack lasted several minutes before the assailant was stopped by a passerby near the city's Dam Square on Thursday. Two people from the United States, one from Belgium and one from Poland were wounded.

title: Nicolas Sarkozy's trial: Prosecutors request 7-year prison sentence for the former president
summary: Sarkozy is charged with having allegedly made a deal with Muammar Gaddafi to finance his 2007 presidential election campaign.

title: Macron's chief of staff, Alexis Kohler, resigns
summary: Kohler, a long-time ally of the French president, has been Macron's chief of staff since he was first elected to the Elysée, in May 2017.

title: Cognac faces the double threat of Chinese and US tariffs
summary: The Charente industry has issued a distress call. Its economy could collapse due to a potential border surtax of 39% which could be imposed by the Chinese authorities on April 5, followed by a 200% tariff from the Trump administration a few days later.

title: NBA and FIBA to take next steps toward adding a new European league
summary: The announcement made Thursday by NBA Commissioner Adam Silver and FIBA Secretary General Andreas Zagklis is a major step forward after a long process of the sides going back and forth with ideas about what might work.

title: Depardieu trial: Prosecutors request 18-month suspended jail sentence
summary: In this trial, two women accuse the French actor of sexual assault during the filming in 2021 of 'The Green Shutters,' a movie directed by Jean Becker.

title: Algeria sentences French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal to five years in prison
summary: The 80-year-old writer, who suffers from cancer, has been detained in Algeria since November 2024. The ruling comes amid a diplomatic crisis between Paris and Algiers.

title: US Department of Health to lay off 10,000 workers in a major restructuring plan
summary: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. described the department as an inefficient 'sprawling bureaucracy' in a video announcing the restructuring on Thursday. He blamed the department's 82,000 workers for a decline in Americans' health.

title: French toddler death: End of custody for relatives does not mean family trail is closed, prosecutor says
summary: The grandparents, an uncle and an aunt were released without charge on Thursday. Investigators now consider 'the intervention of a third party' likely, and are giving priority to the criminal angle.

title: French far-right leader kicks off controversial trip to Israel with a visit to the Yad Vashem Institute
summary: Jordan Bardella, whose invitation by the Israeli government was criticized by representatives of the Jewish community, paid tribute to the victims of October 7 and the Holocaust.

title: Paris summit to fight malnutrition opens in midst of a funding crisis
summary: The international gathering hosted by France is the first of its kind since the majority of American funding for humanitarian aid and development has been halted.

title: Trump's 25% tariffs on car imports worries manufacturers and consumers alike
summary: Americans could pay an additional $5,000 to $10,000 per imported vehicle, which accounts for half of all sales in the country.

title: As he approaches his 90th birthday, the Dalai Lama prepares for his reincarnation
summary: In exile in India, Tenzin Gyatso explained in a book that his successor would be born outside China, while the Chinese authorities intend to appoint their own Dalai Lama.

title: Cocaine prices at their lowest since 2014 in France
summary: A gram of the drug now costs €58, compared with an average of €65 over the last 10 years. This unprecedented drop is due to the abundance of the product and competition between criminal networks and also reflects the increase in the number of consumers.

title: Egypt: Red Sea tourist submarine sinking causes deaths
summary: The submarine had, according to the Red Sea region's governor, been carrying 45 tourists 'of different nationalities' and 5 local crew members when it sank, leading to the deaths of 6 Russians, including 2 minors.

title: Silicon Valley's nine richest billionaires have 15 times more liquid wealth than half the region's population
summary: According to the Silicon Valley Index, which has been measuring the health of the region's economy and population since 1995, the concentration of wealth has never been so strong.

title: Thousands of jobs at risk after tariff-hit British Steel confirms furnace closures
summary: Announcing the closures on Thursday, the company said the closures were necessary 'due to highly challenging market conditions, the imposition of tariffs, and higher environmental costs relating to the production of high-carbon steel.'
